content.description: This granite wall is about twenty feet high at its highest point and offers several close-to-the-groud easy warmup traverses. The traverses can be modified to be more difficult.   There are several easy/forgiving slopers and some more challenging crimps along these traverses. The top-out routes are more limited in number and are generally easy, although there are a few small finger pockets that can be used to add difficulty.    The ground is soft & flat, perfect for several mats, and a big fallen tree offers a nice spot to sit and rest. Mountain bikers frequently ride by at a safe distance (since the wall is not directly on a trail).Great spot!
